Articles.Content:
This challenge has ended

The winner is Jasonbail with time 1 min 32 s.

Congratulations!

There is an island nearby KSC. Distance is 31,6 km and heading is about 118 degrees. On that island is air base with air strip.

Your mission is to build a ship, fly to that island and land to that grey/brown airstrip. Fastest pilot is a winner!

Restrictions: no aerodynamic parts, no jet engines, stock only. Must have atleast one kerbal onboard. Kerbal and your ship must survive from landing.

No degub console/mode.

Staging, parachutes, everything goes.

Take a screenshot when you have landed and your speed is 0 m/s. Show your picture here.

This challenge is started 9th December 2013 and shall end 1st January 2014. I try to refresh the leaders list everyday.

The winner will be a winner ... what else?

Good luck!

Here is example picture (bad landing, but ship and kerbal survived):

LEADERS:

1. Jasonbail............................................1 min 32 s

2. voneiden............................................1 min 45 s

3. Haprdon.............................................1 min 50 s

4. 700NitroXpress ...................................1 min 53 s

5. agentKmurph......................................1 min 54 s

6. Kasuha..............................................2 min 06 s

7. GuzWaatensen.....................................2 min 35 s

Edited December 31, 2013 by totalitor
This should be stock only (no MechJeb), as I don't see the point of using it. Also, can we use staging and drop stuff before landing?

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/48845-33-1km-Emergency-Rescue-on-Jeb-s-Burger!

Similar challenge above.

Although it's not written clearly I believe SSTI (single stage to island) is assumed, otherwise the clause about not breaking anything does not make sense if all you'd need to land would be a pod and a chute. At least I don't see parachutes being forbidden by rules.

I made some changes to rules, thanks folks.

Target is the same as Sirine wrote, but no aerodynamics parts are allowed.

Edited December 9, 2013 by totalitor
Hmmm...how to delete old posts?

Might as well make the first entry. Judging by the other thread, this is easily beaten i suppose:

Time: 2:35

Okay, got to participate, too.

2:06. Sorry for sideways shot, I was in chase camera mode. And when I wanted to screenshot Jeb planting a flag with vertical camera already, the game crashed.

It all starts with good aiming

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Nice rockets! You are fast too!

I don't think there really needs to be a time limit on this challenge. Its pretty cool without any deadline.

Perhaps I will give this a try
Island launcher away. Time 1:18
Incredible. First I thought that with parachutes it would be too slow but I guess i was wrong.

Island launcher away. Time 1:18

I didn't know such little fuel could suffice...

Edit: oh I see. Infinite fuel apparently also falls under "everything goes". Not my style, though.

Incredible. First I thought that with parachutes it would be too slow but I guess i was wrong.

I don't know how others but I opened the drogue about at the tower height and the main chute about 1 m above ground. That definitely doesn't take long to get through. It's almost on the edge of what staging delay allows you. But it was also enough to get me from 200+ m/s to survivable speed.

Edited December 10, 2013 by Kasuha

I didn't know such little fuel could suffice...

Edit: oh I see. Infinite fuel apparently also falls under "everything goes". Not my style, though.

Yeah, it never says no debug options. Kind of makes it more interesting, give it a shot.
I smell infinite fuel! Tried same design different ways it can't go even 2km. I assume infinite fuel is not allowed?

I smell infinite fuel! Tried same design different ways it can't go even 2km. I assume infinite fuel is not allowed?

It says everything goes.
Rules: stock only. Should I remove result of 700NitroXpress? And should I remove words "everything goes"?

Rules: stock only. Should I remove result of 700NitroXpress? And should I remove words "everything goes"?

No, this makes it more fun.

Beat the time too. New Time 1:05

It's possible to do it around 0:55 seconds, but it's hard.

Debug menu with all its options is part of stock game. So if you wanted to prevent people using debug menu and functions it offers, you should have declared it in rules. There's plenty of examples how a good challenge should look like. All it takes is to look around.

No, this makes it more fun.

I can get it to the island in 0:00 by small change in the persistence file and I don't need to use any mods for that. I just don't think it is fun at all.

I can get it to the island in 0:00 by small change in the persistence file and I don't need to use any mods for that. I just don't think it is fun at all.

You don't need to edit the file for that.

Here is my no debug console entry, Time 1:53

Use whichever entry makes you feel better, I'm fine with either.

Edited December 11, 2013 by 700NitroXpress

I respectfully submit 1 minute and 54 seconds. No debug menu.

This was the original craft. 6 asparagus staged Mainsails on Rockomax 200-32 fuel tanks.

Edited December 12, 2013 by agentKmurph
